meanings.definition: A social event with Scottish or Irish folk music and dancing.
meanings.sent1: We had a ceilidhs last night with lively music and dancing.
meanings.sent2: The community center hosts ceilidhs every month for everyone to enjoy.
meanings.sent3: At the ceilidhs, the music was so catchy that even the shyest person couldn't resist dancing.
meanings.sent4: The ceilidhs was a whirlwind of music and movement, like a joyful storm.
meanings.sent5: I'll never forget the ceilidhs where I first learned to dance to traditional tunes.

meanings.definition: The plural form of ceilidh, referring to multiple such events.
meanings.sent1: During the summer, we attended several ceilidhs in the park.
meanings.sent2: The ceilidhs in the village are always a highlight of the year.
meanings.sent3: Imagine trying to keep track of all the ceilidhs happening in town at the same time!
meanings.sent4: The ceilidhs dotted the town's calendar like colorful gems.
meanings.sent5: The ceilidhs brought the whole community together in a joyful celebration.
